company.name: Medable, Inc.
company.address: 525 University Ave., Suite A70 Palo Alto, CA 94301
company.business_description: Medable provides technology solutions to business customers operating in pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and research industries.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act

complaint.factual_background: Medable, Inc., a technology solutions provider serving pharmaceutical, biotechnology, and research industries, falsely claimed in its privacy policy to be certified under the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework. While Medable initiated a certification application with the U.S. Department of Commerce in December 2017, it never completed the necessary steps to achieve certification. Despite this, Medable continued to publish statements on its website claiming it was 'EU/US Privacy Shield certified' and that it had 'certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles' until October 2018. These misrepresentations constituted deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the FTC Act.

representations_made.description: Claimed to be EU/US Privacy Shield certified and that personal information from the European Economic Area would be treated in accordance with EU data privacy principles under that certification
representations_made.quoted_text: Information for Persons Outside of the United States As we are a US headquartered company, your personal information will be transferred to the US for further processing in accordance with the purposes set out above. Accordingly, Medable is EU/US Privacy Shield certified which means that we treat your personal information received from the European Economic Area (EEA) in accordance with EU data privacy principles. Please see our Privacy Shield Privacy Policy below for more details. . . .

representations_made.description: Claimed to have certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles, and directed users to privacyshield.gov to view its certification
representations_made.quoted_text: Privacy Shield Privacy Policy Medable has certified to the Department of Commerce that it adheres to the Privacy Shield Principles. If there is any conflict between the terms in this privacy policy and the Privacy Shield Principles, the Privacy Shield Principles shall govern. To learn more about the Privacy Shield program, and to view our certification, please visit https://www.privacyshield.gov/

counts.title: Privacy Shield Misrepresentation
counts.representation: From December 2017 to October 2018, Respondent represented, directly or indirectly, expressly or by implication, that it was a participant in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework.
counts.fact: Respondent was never certified to participate in the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework. Although it initiated an application in December 2017, it did not complete the steps necessary to participate.
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 12 is false or misleading, constituting deceptive acts or practices in violation of Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act.

definitions.Respondent: Medable, Inc., a corporation, and its successors and assigns.

provisions.title: Prohibition against Misrepresentations about Participation in or Compliance with Privacy Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent and all affiliated persons must not misrepresent in any manner the extent to which Respondent is a member of, complies with, or participates in any privacy or security program, including the EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent participation in or compliance with any government or self-regulatory privacy or security program, including EU-U.S. and Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield frameworks, in connection with advertising, marketing, promotion, or sale of any product or service
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that Respondent and its officers, agents, employees, and attorneys, and all other persons in active concert or participation with any of them, who receive actual notice of this Order, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service must not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss- U.S. Privacy Shield framework.

provisions.title: Acknowledgments of the Order
provisions.summary: Respondent must submit its own acknowledgment of receipt, deliver copies of the Order to relevant personnel and successor entities, and obtain signed acknowledgments from each recipient.

requirements.description: Respondent must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order within ten (10) days after the effective date
requirements.quoted_text: A. Respondent, within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order, must submit to the Commission an acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

requirements.description: For five (5) years after the issuance date, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to all principals, officers, directors, LLC managers and members, employees with managerial responsibilities related to privacy/security program representations, and any business entity resulting from a change in structure; delivery must occur within ten (10) days for current personnel and before others assume their responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: B. For five (5) years after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must deliver a copy of this Order to: (1) all principals, officers, directors, and LLC managers and members; (2) all employees having managerial responsibilities for, and all agents and representatives who participate in, conduct related to representing in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which Respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is Page 2 of 5 certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by a government or any self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including but not limited to the EU-U.S. Privacy Shield framework and the Swiss-U.S. Privacy Shield framework; and (3) any business entity resulting from any change in structure as set forth in the Provision titled Compliance Report and Notices. Delivery must occur within ten (10) days after the effective date of this Order for current personnel. For all others, delivery must occur before they assume their responsibilities.
requirements.deadline: 10 days (current personnel); before responsibilities assumed (new personnel)

requirements.description: From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of the Order, Respondent must obtain a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt within sixty (60) days
requirements.quoted_text: C. From each individual or entity to which Respondent delivered a copy of this Order, Respondent must obtain, within sixty (60) days, a signed and dated acknowledgment of receipt of this Order.

provisions.title: Compliance Report and Notices
provisions.summary: Respondent must file an initial sworn compliance report within 60 days and submit timely notices of changes in contact information, corporate structure, or bankruptcy filings, following specified submission procedures.

requirements.description: Within sixty (60) days of the issuance date, submit a sworn compliance report identifying contact information, all businesses, their activities, compliance with each Order provision, and copies of acknowledgments obtained
requirements.quoted_text: A. Sixty (60) days after the issuance date of this Order, Respondent must submit a compliance report, sworn under penalty of perjury, in which Respondent must: (a) identify the primary physical, postal, and email address and telephone number, as designated points of contact, which representatives of the Commission, may use to communicate with Respondent; (b) identify all of Respondent’s businesses by all of their names, telephone numbers, and physical, postal, email, and Internet addresses; (c) describe the activities of each business; (d) describe in detail whether and how Respondent is in compliance with each Provision of this Order; and (e) provide a copy of each Acknowledgment of the Order obtained pursuant to this Order, unless previously submitted to the Commission.

requirements.description: Submit a sworn compliance notice within fourteen (14) days of any change in designated points of contact or in Respondent's corporate structure (including creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of any relevant entity)
requirements.quoted_text: B. Respondent must submit a compliance notice, sworn under penalty of perjury, within fourteen (14) days of any change in the following: (1) any designated point of contact; or (2) the structure of Respondent or any entity that Respondent has any ownership interest in or controls directly or indirectly that may affect compliance obligations arising under this Order, including: creation, merger, sale, or dissolution of the entity or any subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Submit notice of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding filed by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing
requirements.quoted_text: C. Respondent must submit notice of the filing of any bankruptcy petition, insolvency proceeding, or similar proceeding by or against Respondent within fourteen (14) days of its filing.

requirements.description: All submissions sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate, comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, include the required declaration language, date, full name, title, and signature
requirements.quoted_text: D. Any submission to the Commission required by this Order to be sworn under penalty of perjury must be true and accurate and comply with 28 U.S.C. § 1746, such as by concluding: “I declare under penalty of perjury under the laws of the United States of America that the foregoing is true and correct. Executed on: _____” and supplying the Page 3 of 5 date, signatory’s full name, title (if applicable), and signature.

requirements.description: Unless otherwise directed, all submissions must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier to the FTC's Associate Director of Enforcement, with the subject line beginning: In re Medable, Inc., FTC File No. 1823192
requirements.quoted_text: E. Unless otherwise directed by a Commission representative in writing, all submissions to the Commission pursuant to this Order must be emailed to Debrief@ftc.gov or sent by overnight courier (not the U.S. Postal Service) to: Associate Director of Enforcement, Bureau of Consumer Protection, Federal Trade Commission, 600 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Washington, D.C. 20580. The subject line must begin: In re Medable, Inc., FTC File No. 1823192.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping
provisions.summary: Respondent must create specified records for ten (10) years and retain each for five (5) years, covering personnel, compliance documentation, and copies of representations subject to this Order.

requirements.description: Create and retain personnel records for each person providing services related to any aspect of this Order, including name, addresses, telephone numbers, job title, dates of service, and reason for termination; records must be created for ten (10) years and retained for five (5) years
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Respondent must create certain records for ten (10) years after the issuance date of the Order, and retain each such record for five (5) years. Specifically, Respondent must create and retain the following records: A. personnel records showing, for each person providing services in relation to any aspect of this Order, whether as an employee or otherwise, that person’s: name; addresses; telephone numbers; job title or position; dates of service; and (if applicable) the reason for termination;

requirements.description: Create and retain all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission
requirements.quoted_text: B. all records necessary to demonstrate full compliance with each provision of this Order, including all submissions to the Commission; and

requirements.description: Create and retain a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent that is subject to this Order, and all materials relied upon in making those representations
requirements.quoted_text: C. a copy of each widely disseminated representation by Respondent making any representation subject to this Order, and all materials that were relied upon in making the representation.

provisions.title: Compliance Monitoring
provisions.summary: The Commission is authorized to monitor Respondent's compliance by requesting reports and records, communicating directly with and interviewing Respondent's personnel, and using other lawful investigative means including undercover contacts.

requirements.description: Within ten (10) days of receiving a written request from a Commission representative, Respondent must submit additional compliance reports or other requested information (sworn under penalty of perjury) and produce records for inspection and copying
requirements.quoted_text: A. Within ten (10) days of receipt of a written request from a representative of the Commission, Respondent must: submit additional compliance reports or other requested information, which must be sworn under penalty of perjury, and produce records for inspection and copying.

requirements.description: Respondent must permit Commission representatives to communicate directly with Respondent and to interview any affiliated individual who has agreed to such an interview; the interviewee may have counsel present
requirements.quoted_text: B. For matters concerning this Order, representatives of the Commission are authorized to communicate directly with Respondent. Respondent must permit representatives of the Commission to interview anyone affiliated with Respondent who has agreed to such an interview. The interviewee may have counsel present.

requirements.description: The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals without identification or prior notice, and may use compulsory process under Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act
requirements.quoted_text: C. The Commission may use all other lawful means, including posing through its Page 4 of 5 representatives as consumers, suppliers, or other individuals or entities, to Respondent or any individual or entity affiliated with Respondent, without the necessity of identification or prior notice. Nothing in this Order limits the Commission’s lawful use of compulsory process, pursuant to Sections 9 and 20 of the FTC Act, 15 U.S.C. §§ 49, 57b-1.

provisions.title: Order Effective Dates
provisions.summary: The Order is effective upon publication on ftc.gov and terminates twenty (20) years from issuance, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date a complaint alleging a violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later, subject to specified exceptions.

requirements.description: Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission's website (ftc.gov) as a final order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this Order is final and effective upon the date of its publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate

requirements.description: Order terminates twenty (20) years from issuance or twenty (20) years from the most recent date the United States or the Commission files a complaint in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later, subject to enumerated exceptions
requirements.quoted_text: publication on the Commission’s website (ftc.gov) as a final order. This Order will terminate twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance, (which date may be stated at the end of this Order, near the Commission’s seal), or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order’s application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision. Provided, further, that if such complaint is dismissed or a federal court rules that Respondent did not violate any provision of the Order, and the dismissal or ruling is either not appealed or upheld on appeal, then the Order will terminate according to this Provision as though the complaint had never been filed, except that the Order will not terminate between the date such complaint is filed and the later of the deadline for appealing such dismissal or ruling and the date such dismissal or ruling is upheld on appeal.

duration.termination_text: This Order will terminate twenty (20) years from the date of its issuance, (which date may be stated at the end of this Order, near the Commission's seal), or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying settlement) in federal court alleging any violation of the Order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of: A. any Provision in this Order that terminates in less than twenty (20) years; B. this Order's application to any respondent that is not named as a defendant in such complaint; and C. this Order if such complaint is filed after the order has terminated pursuant to this Provision.
